Markdown is a superset of HTML, so any HTML file is a valid Markdown.

Headings

This is an h1

## This is an h2 ### This is an h3 #### This is an h4 ##### This is an h5 ###### This is an h6

This is an h1

This is an h2 ————-

Text styles

This text is in italics.
And so is this text

This text is in bold
And so is this text

This text is in both.

~~This text is rendered with strikethrough.~~

monospace

Paragraphs

This is a paragraph.

Now I’m in paragraph 2. I’m still in paragraph 2 too!

I’m in paragraph three!

Leave 2 spaces at the end of a line to to a
line break

This is a block quote. You can

manually wrap your lines and put a > before every line. You can also use more than one level > of indentation. How neat is that?

Lists

Unordered lists

  • Item1
  • Item2
  • Item3

or

  • Item1
  • Item2
  • Item3

or

  • Item1
  • Item2
  • Item3

Ordered lists

  1. Item1
    • Sub1
    • Sub2
    • Sub3
  2. Item2
  3. Item3

Code blocks

You can indicate a code block by indenting a line with four spaces or a tab.

-module(test).
-export([test/0]).

test() ->
    io:format("Hello World!~n").
